snippet: The case of the former defense minister, Akis Tsochatzopoulos, has raised emotional issues in a political culture widely seen as rife with corruption.
abstract: Case of Akis Tsochatzopoulos, the highest-ranking Greek official ever to be detained on corruption charges, marks the fall of a political culture that has dominated Greece for decades and that helped drive up its public debt to the point that it was forced to seek a foreign bailout in 2010; the entrenched favors-for-votes culture is coming unglued, and Greeks have become less forgiving of high-level missteps.

byline.original: By RACHEL DONADIO and NIKI KITSANTONIS

lead_paragraph: The case of the former defense minister, Akis Tsochatzopoulos, has raised emotional issues in a political culture widely seen as rife with corruption.

headline.seo: Greek Official’s Corruption Case Hits Hard
headline.main: Corruption Case Hits Hard in a Tough Time for Greece
headline.print_headline: Corruption Case Hits Hard In a Tough Time for Greece
